summary.p: François Déroche schreibt zum Fragment QUR 48 und QUR 80 (Déroche, The Abbasid Tradition, London 1992, S. 56): "10 / Qur'an fragment / 9th century AD / 49 folios, 11x17.8cm, with 17 lines to the page / Material Parchment / Text area 8.4x13.9cm / Script Style B.II / Binding Modern / Accession nos QUR48 and QUR80 / The text is written in black ink. Red dots indicate the vocalization. Three strokes (I.I.I) mark the end of each verse. The end of each group of ten verses is indicated by a plain red circle (I.A.I) with a letter at its centre giving the number of verses according to abjad system. The title and verse count of each surah are in red, and at the end of every surah the verse count is given in abjad at the centre of a red I.A.I circle. Folio II is a repair, and a later hand has added the indication of a ḥizb and a juzʾ division in the margin of folio 14b and 15a. / The quires of this manuscript have ten folios, which are arranged in the usual fashion: the hair side of the first folio is the recto, and the following folios are arranged on the same lines. / If the width of the text area is divided by the height, the quotient is very close to that of the golden rectangle. The same seems to hold true for the page as a whole, but it is always difficult to come to an firm conclusions about folio size, firstly because folios were often heavily trimmed in the course of the frequent restorations required by the weakness of early bindings, and secondly because we do not know whether the parchment was cut according to the natural size of the hide or to give the calligrapher the size of folio he wanted. / The text contained in this fragment is as follows: Sūrat al-anʿām (VI), verse 153, to Sūrat al-aʿrāf (VII), verses 46-172 (folios 1-2); Sūrat al-aʿrāf, verse 206, to Sūrat Hūd (XI), verse 25 (folios 12-36); Sūrat Hūd, verses 40-73 (folios 37-38); and Sūrat Hūd, verse 89, to Sūrat Yūsuf (XII), verse 29 (folios 39-49)."
